post_text:
Hello,

This Facebook page has been created in an effort to better our communication with our families, and our community. We are excited about being able to share our events and achievements with you. Please be advised that If you have specific questions, contacting your school directly is still the best way for us to assist you.
Thank you :)

post_text:
Dual Language Immersion Instruction Comes to AP Morris.
Under the leadership of Principal Ms. April Lowe, Hillside Public Schools is proud to announce that A.P. Morris has been awarded a $198,255 State grant through the Preschool Education Expansion Aid. With this funding, the district will create a new Pre K3 Dual Language Immersion Program for the 2018-2019 school year.

Research affirms that the ability to speak and read in more than one language offers social, cultural, cognitive, and economic benefits. This new program will use a dual-language model, in which the Pre K3 children will receive instruction in English and Spanish.

Ms. Lowe and the AP Morris staff believe this new program will help the children increase their literacy skills and become proficient readers by the end of third grade. Hillside is excited about this opportunity as we continue to implement innovative best practices, meeting the needs of all our students
text:
Dual Language Immersion Instruction Comes to AP Morris.
Under the leadership of Principal Ms. April Lowe, Hillside Public Schools is proud to announce that A.P. Morris has been awarded a $198,255 State grant through the Preschool Education Expansion Aid. With this funding, the district will create a new Pre K3 Dual Language Immersion Program for the 2018-2019 school year.

Research affirms that the ability to speak and read in more than one language offers social, cultural, cognitive, and economic benefits. This new program will use a dual-language model, in which the Pre K3 children will receive instruction in English and Spanish.

Ms. Lowe and the AP Morris staff believe this new program will help the children increase their literacy skills and become proficient readers by the end of third grade. Hillside is excited about this opportunity as we continue to implement innovative best practices, meeting the needs of all our students

post_text:
APPLICATIONS ARE CURRENTLY BEING ACCEPTED FOR SUMMER ACADEMY! WOK & KULA (KEAN UNIVERSITY LEARNING ADVENTURES) are partnering for a fantastic Summer educational experience for 6-8 graders. Summer Academy takes place from 8:30-12:30 (Academic Instruction) and 12:30-3:30 (KULA Activities) on Monday-Thursday. Fridays are reserved for Field Trips planned by KULA. Summer Academy starts July 6th and ends August 2nd. The applications can be found on WOK's website. Please turn in applications at WOK. Spaces for the program are on a first come, first serve basis and it is free.
http://tinyurl.com/y7ygaf68

post_text: On Monday, November 7, 2016 George Washington students participated in a mock Presidential election. After a visit from Hillside Honorable Mayor Angela Garretson who spoke to them on the importance of exercising their right to vote, students cast their ballots as a culminating activity. This was preceded by a unit of study on the U.S. electoral process which the students were engaged in during social studies lessons. The George Washington School election results were as follows; 222 votes for Hillary Clinton and 22 votes for Donald Trump.
text: On Monday, November 7, 2016 George Washington students participated in a mock Presidential election. After a visit from Hillside Honorable Mayor Angela Garretson who spoke to them on the importance of exercising their right to vote, students cast their ballots as a culminating activity. This was preceded by a unit of study on the U.S. electoral process which the students were engaged in during social studies lessons. The George Washington School election results were as follows; 222 votes for Hillary Clinton and 22 votes for Donald Trump.

post_text:
We are excited about our 1:1 Chromebook initiative. As you know, this is a tremendous leap forward for our instructional program. If your child or student is unable to connect to the wireless network at home, please have him/her try this:

It is recommended that when students leave for the day, that they completely turn off their Chromebooks rather than just closing them so that when they get home the Chromebook has to search for another wireless network. This should resolve the problem. If students still continue to have issues from home once they have followed this proper shut down procedure, please have them document what error they are getting so that our Tech Department can determine the cause of the problem.
text:

This should resolve the problem. If students still continue to have issues from home once they have followed this proper shut down procedure, please have them document what error they are getting so that our Tech Department can determine the cause of the problem.

post_text: This Saturday, September 26, 2015 the Hillside High School Varsity Football Team will play at home vs. Rahway High School at 1:00 P.M. at Woodfield Stadium. At halftime there will be a special dedication to John Zappulla, long time teacher and football coach in the Hillside School District, who passed away on June 27, 2015. Coach Zap spent over forty years here as a physical education teacher and fifty two years as an assistant football coach. Please join us this Saturday at 1:00 P.M. as we honor him and pay tribute to his commitment to the children of Hillside and the Hillside High School Football program.
text: This Saturday, September 26, 2015 the Hillside High School Varsity Football Team will play at home vs. Rahway High School at 1:00 P.M. at Woodfield Stadium. At halftime there will be a special dedication to John Zappulla, long time teacher and football coach in the Hillside School District, who passed away on June 27, 2015. Coach Zap spent over forty years here as a physical education teacher and fifty two years as an assistant football coach. Please join us this Saturday at 1:00 P.M. as we honor him and pay tribute to his commitment to the children of Hillside and the Hillside High School Football program.

post_text:
As you may know, keyboarding skills are an important part of our PARCC test preparation.

Here are some free online keyboarding resources your child can practice at home:

Animated Typing tutorial for all. This is a great starting point for anyone who would like to improve his/her keyboarding skills. (It is free, so you may choose to skip the ads): http://www.sense-lang.org/typing/tutor/video-index.php

For our little ones:
Dance Mat Typing: http://www.bbc.co.uk/guides/z3c6tfr#z34thyc
ABCYa! Cup Stacking: http://www.abcya.com/cup_stack_typing_game.htm

Intermediate:
Alpha Munchies: http://www.abcya.com/kids_typing_game.htm

As you may know, keyboarding skills are an important part of our PARCC test preparation.

Here are some free online keyboarding resources your child can practice at home:

Animated Typing tutorial for all. This is a great starting point for anyone who would like to improve his/her keyboarding skills. (It is free, so you may choose to skip the ads): http://www.sense-lang.org/typing/tutor/video-index.php

For our little ones:
Dance Mat Typing: http://www.bbc.co.uk/guides/z3c6tfr#z34thyc
ABCYa! Cup Stacking: http://www.abcya.com/cup_stack_typing_game.htm

post_text:
Dear Parents and Guardians:

The final administration of the PARCC tests will be April 27 – May 6. A percentage of parents decided to not have their children participate in the March administration. Should you decide to have your child “opt-out” or not take the final administration of the test, you will need to send a new letter to the Principal of your school. Please send a letter that includes your name, your child’s name, school and grade, and your email address and telephone number in case verification is needed. Please send this signed letter before April 27. Please do not send an email.

Thank you for your anticipated cooperation.

Frank J. Deo, Ed.D.
Superintendent

2015-2016 School Year

A.P. MORRIS EARLY CHILDHOOD CENTER
143 Coe Avenue
Hillside, New Jersey 07205
(908) 352-7664 Ext. 5500

April 27th - May 1st, 2015

Children registering for kindergarten must be 5 years old on or before October 1, 2015

Medical Immunization Records

2. Current utility bill
3. Driver’s license, bank statement, current pay stub, state agency document

post_text:
Class of 1964 visits Hillside High School
The Hillside High School Class of 1964 held their 50th reunion at a dinner dance on Saturday October 18, 2014. On Friday, October 17, they also visited their alma matter and were treated to a luncheon at Hillside High School where they met current students. The students told them about life at H.H.S. this year, while the class of ’64 told them about H.H.S. in the “old days”. After lunch, the class of ’64 was given a tour of the building by Mrs. Christine Sidwa, Principal. Their high school fun was not over that day. On Saturday, several class of ’64 members joined the high school band at the football game and marched onto the field at half time. The former students were welcomed back with open arms by the current students, some traveling as far as California for the festivities.

Pics coming soon!
text:
Class of 1964 visits Hillside High School
The Hillside High School Class of 1964 held their 50th reunion at a dinner dance on Saturday October 18, 2014. On Friday, October 17, they also visited their alma matter and were treated to a luncheon at Hillside High School where they met current students. The students told them about life at H.H.S. this year, while the class of ’64 told them about H.H.S. in the “old days”. After lunch, the class of ’64 was given a tour of the building by Mrs. Christine Sidwa, Principal. Their high school fun was not over that day. On Saturday, several class of ’64 members joined the high school band at the football game and marched onto the field at half time. The former students were welcomed back with open arms by the current students, some traveling as far as California for the festivities.

Pics coming soon!

post_text:
Congratulations to Our Hillside High School Student Scientists!

Hillside High School got second place in the National Chemistry Week competition that took place at the Liberty Science Center on Saturday 10/18/14.

The theme was chemistry in Candy. Students had experiments on how the size of the gummy bears changes in different solutions (Osmosis), candy that floats and the other that sinks(density), Mentos and Soda(Gases), Marshmallow and the syringe (Boyle's law: Volume is inversely related to pressure). Special thanks to Mr. Coleman, who also participated in the trip.
text:
Congratulations to Our Hillside High School Student Scientists!

Hillside High School got second place in the National Chemistry Week competition that took place at the Liberty Science Center on Saturday 10/18/14.

The theme was chemistry in Candy. Students had experiments on how the size of the gummy bears changes in different solutions (Osmosis), candy that floats and the other that sinks(density), Mentos and Soda(Gases), Marshmallow and the syringe (Boyle's law: Volume is inversely related to pressure). Special thanks to Mr. Coleman, who also participated in the trip.

post_text:
PARCC Pilot Testing
A new test called Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC ) is coming to take the place of NJASK and HSPA. The new test is scheduled to be given during the 2014-2015 school year to all students across New Jersey. PARCC was piloted at HL, GW,WOK and HHS. Our objective was to test the technology and get some idea of the format of the new test. The state has informed us the new test will require much more of students than just a test of knowledge. Students will need to problem solve, determine the best answer from a number of correct answers, and other skills not tested on previous tests. The Chromebooks recently purchased for our students worked well. Over 300 students were tested with very few technical issues.
text:
PARCC Pilot Testing
A new test called Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC ) is coming to take the place of NJASK and HSPA. The new test is scheduled to be given during the 2014-2015 school year to all students across New Jersey. PARCC was piloted at HL, GW,WOK and HHS. Our objective was to test the technology and get some idea of the format of the new test. The state has informed us the new test will require much more of students than just a test of knowledge. Students will need to problem solve, determine the best answer from a number of correct answers, and other skills not tested on previous tests. The Chromebooks recently purchased for our students worked well. Over 300 students were tested with very few technical issues.

post_text:
A Message from the Superintendent

The Arts are alive within the Hillside Schools! Actually, the Arts are growing at our schools. With the addition of new music staff this year we have seen an increase in opportunities for students.

Unfortunately, we have been unable to maintain Saybrook as a viable satellite school for the Arts. The programs offered at Saybrook for the past two years will continue to be offered at Hillside High School.

Saybrook School will be converted to offices and a Board of Education meeting room. The movement of offices will allow for increased classroom space at Hillside High School for the 2014-2015 school year.

We continually strive to improve both our facilities and academic programs to provide every student, every learning opportunity, every day.

Sincerely,

Frank J. Deo. Ed. D.
Superintendent
”Providing Every Student, Every Learning Opportunity, Every Day”

A.P. MORRIS EARLY CHILDHOOD CENTER
143 Coe Avenue
Hillside, New Jersey 07205
(908) 352-7664 Ext. 5500

REGISTRATION for 2014-2015 SCHOOL YEAR

KINDERGARTEN REGISTRATION

A child must be five (5) years old
on or before October 1, 2014

Registration will begin on
Monday, May 19, 2014
At A.P. Morris Early Childhood Center
10:00 AM-2:00 PM

Thursday, May 22, 2014
4:00 PM- 6:30 PM

Only complete packets will be accepted.
Bring with you:
Birth Certificate
Medical Immunization Records
Three (3) proofs of Hillside residency (1 from each category)
1. Current tax bill, mortgage statement, lease
2. Current utility bill
3. Driver’s license, bank statement, current pay stub, state agency document

Legal Documents of Custody and Guardianship, if necessary.

post_text:
A.P. MORRIS EARLY CHILDHOOD CENTER
143 Coe Avenue
Hillside, New Jersey 07205
(908) 352-7664 Ext. 5500

REGISTRATION for 2014-2015 SCHOOL YEAR

PRE-K REGISTRATION

A child must be four (4) years old
on or before October 1, 2014

During the week of April 28- May 2, 2014
10:00 AM- 2:00 PM

Parents are to come to school and sign a registration lottery ticket for entrance into the Pre-K classes. Lottery drawing will be on Tuesday, May 6, 2014 at 3:30 PM.
All are invited to attend.

Lottery winners not attending the lottery, packets will be mailed on May 7, 2014.
Completed registration packets MUST be returned the week of May 12, 2014.
Students not registered by Friday, May 16th will forfeit their spot.

Only complete packets will be accepted.
Bring with you:
Birth Certificate
Medical Immunization Records
Three (3) proofs of Hillside residency (1 from each category)
1. Current tax bill, mortgage statement, lease
2. Current utility bill
3. Driver’s license, bank statement, current pay stub, state agency document

Legal Documents of Custody and Guardianship, if necessary.

post_text: We are closed today due to inclement weather. Stay warm everyone.

post_text: Hillside High School TV production has entered their first national film challenge. They were to create a parody of a popular song and submit their video for online voting. Please click the link and enjoy our version of Shaggy’s, “It Wasn’t Me” now as “That’s Why We Cheat.” This is a comical parody and very much fiction. Please click the thumbs up to like our film. You can vote often so please do! Share the link with others who would like a laugh as well!

post_text:
Dear Hillside Residents and Friends,
The Hillside Schools are establishing this Facebook page to keep the public informed of what is happening in the Hillside Public Schools. Hillside is a diverse learning community of over 3,135 students in pre-kindergarten through grade 12. Our motto of providing every student, every learning opportunity, every day is practiced daily by a committed staff. In the coming months we hope to post upcoming school news, academic, sporting and social events to increase communications between school and home. We hope you find this page helpful and interesting.
Sincerely yours,
Dr. Frank Deo
Superintendent of Schools
